properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Chuska Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 4:17PM MST until January 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...STORM TO BRING SNOW TO PARTS OF NORTH CENTRAL AND WESTERN NM...

.A storm system will cross the state from the west late tonight
through Tuesday evening with rain and snow. The system will have a
tap of Pacific moisture and the usual orographic lift. The result
will be a few to several inches of snow over the northern and west
central mountains, as well as the northwest highlands. The snow
level will drop to valley bottoms toward sunrise Tuesday, then
rise above 6500 feet Tuesday afternoon, and then drop some Tuesday
evening as the storm exits to the east.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches,
except 1 to 3 inches below 7500 feet, and locally up to 13
inches on the high peaks of the northern mountains.

* WHERE...Chuska Mountains, West Central Mountains, Tusas
Mountains Including Chama, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre
de Cristo Mountains.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight MST Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed and icy roads. The visibility will
drop below a half mile at times during periods of heavier snow.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means
that periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties.
Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT
